name: poetry

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: about
subcommands.description: Shows information about Poetry.

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: add
subcommands.description: Adds a new dependency to pyproject.toml.

options.description: Extras to activate for the dependency. (multiple values allowed)
Python version for which the dependency must be installed.
Platforms for which the dependency must be installed.
Name of the source to use to install the package.
Output the operations but do not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).
Do not perform operations (only update the lockfile).
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: build
subcommands.description: Builds a package, as a tarball and a wheel by default.

options.description: Limit the format to either sdist or wheel.
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: cache
subcommands.description: Interact with Poetry's cache
subcommands.usage:
poetry cache
poetry cache clear [--all] <cache>
poetry cache list

options.description: Clear all entries in the cache.
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: check
subcommands.description: Checks the validity of the pyproject.toml file.

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: config
subcommands.description: Manages configuration settings.

options.description: Set/Get from the project's local configuration.
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: debug
subcommands.description: Debug various elements of Poetry.

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: poetry
subcommands.description: debug info

subcommands.name: env
subcommands.description: Interact with Poetry's project environments.
subcommands.usage:
poetry env
poetry env info [-p]
poetry env list [--full-path]
poetry env remove <python>
poetry env use <python>

options.description: Output the full paths of the virtualenvs.
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: export
subcommands.description: Exports the lock file to alternative formats.

options.description: Format to export to. Currently, only requirements.txt is supported. (default: "requirements.txt")
The name of the output file.
Exclude hashes from the exported file.
Extra sets of dependencies to include. (multiple values allowed)
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: init
subcommands.description: Creates a basic pyproject.toml file in the current directory.

options.description: Package to require, with an optional version constraint, e.g. requests:^2.10.0 or requests=2.11.1. (multiple values allowed)
Package to require for development, with an optional version constraint, e.g. requests:^2.10.0 or requests=2.11.1. (multiple values allowed)
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: install
subcommands.description: Installs the project dependencies.

options.description: Do not install the development dependencies.
Do not install the root package (the current project).
Output the operations but do not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).
Removes packages not present in the lock file.
Extra sets of dependencies to install. (multiple values allowed)
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: lock
subcommands.description: Locks the project dependencies.

options.description: Do not update locked versions, only refresh lock file.
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: new
subcommands.description: Creates a new Python project at <path>.

options.description: Use the src layout for the project.
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: publish
subcommands.description: Publishes a package to a remote repository.

options.description: The repository to publish the package to.
The username to access the repository.
The password to access the repository.
Certificate authority to access the repository.
Client certificate to access the repository.
Perform all actions except upload the package.
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: remove
subcommands.description: Removes a package from the project dependencies.

options.description: Remove a package from the development dependencies.
Output the operations but do not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: run
subcommands.description: Runs a command in the appropriate environment.

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: search
subcommands.description: Searches for packages on remote repositories.

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: self
subcommands.description: Interact with Poetry directly.

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: shell
subcommands.description: Spawns a shell within the virtual environment.

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: show
subcommands.description: Shows information about packages.

options.description: Do not list the development dependencies.
List the dependencies as a tree.
Show the latest version but only for packages that are outdated.
Show all packages (even those not compatible with current system).
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: update
subcommands.description: Update the dependencies as according to the pyproject.toml file.

options.description: Do not update the development dependencies.
Output the operations but do not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).
Do not perform operations (only update the lockfile).
Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

subcommands.name: version
subcommands.description: Shows the version of the project or bumps it when a valid bump rule is provided.

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: "-v" for normal output, "-vv" for more verbose output and "-vvv" for debug
Do not ask any interactive question

tldr:
> Manage Python packages and dependencies.
> More information: <https://python-poetry.org/docs/cli/>.

- Create a new Poetry project in the directory with a specific name:

`poetry new {{project_name}}`

- Install a dependency and its subdependencies:

`poetry add {{dependency}}`

- Install a development dependency and its subdependencies:

`poetry add --dev {{dependency}}`

- Interactively initialize the current directory as a new Poetry project:

`poetry init`

- Get the latest version of all dependencies and update `poetry.lock`:

`poetry update`

- Execute a command inside the project's virtual environment:

`poetry run {{command}}`

- Bump the minor version of the project in `pyproject.toml`:

`poetry version minor`

- List all poetry subcommands:

`poetry list`
